description: Live text updates as Antrim travel to Tullamore to face Offaly in Division 1B of the Allianz Hurling League.
title: Offaly v Antrim - Division 1B National Hurling league
title_page: Offaly v Antrim - Division 1B National Hurling league - BBC Sport
maintext:
That's all folks
FT: Offaly 2-26 Antrim 0-17
So after the optimism of last weekend's home win over Westmeath, Antrim suffered another chastening defeat on the road today.
They were outclassed. There is no other way to put it.
Davy Fitzgerald now has the task of raising the morale of his players for the home tussle in two weeks against a Waterford side most reckoned as odds-on promotion favourites before the action started last month.
Granted Waterford then lost their opener to Carlow but they opened their account by beating Laois 1-27 to 0-20 today.
So it's going to be tough against the Deise in Corrigan Park before the Saffrons' final two games against Carlow (away) and Laois (home).
You can further pour over the entrails of today's contest by taking a look at our match report which has just been published.
Thanks for your company today.
